message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.PL

The paper discusses security risk management and the use of attack trees to address the challenges of securing large, continuously-changing system designs. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes a systematic approach to automate the construction and maintenance of attack trees, which involves software engineering (cs.SE), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and programming languages (cs.PL) to develop the necessary tools and algorithms. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of a security knowledge database, which could fall under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI) if the database is designed to facilitate collaboration and sharing of security knowledge among stakeholders.
